title: Latest news, political and military related
summary: Hello everyone, this is Yun Jian, your host from Daily News Channel. Welcome to today's global news roundup. In past 24 hours, international situation has seen multiple developments: Trump administration announced a suspension of tariffs on Europe following negotiations with Greenland, but the EU remains on high alert; gold prices broke the $5,000 mark for the first time, reflecting escalating geopolitical risks; tensions in the Taiwan Strait escalated again due to US arms sales to Taiwan, prompting the PLA to launch its largest-ever island-wide military exercise; and the Pentagon released a new version of its defense strategy, downgrading the China threat level and triggering a chain reaction. Now we focus on the latest developments in these key events.

title: Latest global political and military news
summary: Hello everyone, this is Yun Jian, host of the Daily News Channel. Welcome to this episode of "Daily News Channel." Today is January 25, 2026. We focus on the latest global political and military developments of the past 24 hours. Let's start with some major news: The trilateral peace talks between the US, Russia, and Ukraine, led by a special envoy of the Trump administration, began in Abu Dhabi. However, territorial disputes became the biggest obstacle, ending without results on the first day. The talks will continue next week. Meanwhile, Russia launched large-scale airstrikes on Kyiv and other areas in Ukraine, causing civilian casualties and widespread power outages. The military and diplomacy are proceeding simultaneously. Tensions are high in the Middle East. Israel's Ben Gurion Airport was briefly closed, several airlines canceled flights, the US plans to deploy destroyers and fighter jets, and a senior Hamas leader was assassinated, escalating regional conflict. Hotspots are frequent in the Asia-Pacific region. Japan and the Philippines signed a defense agreement to address the South China Sea dispute. China strengthened export controls on dual-use technologies, banned Taiwanese officials from entering the country, and investigated top generals. Taiwan and the US reached a trade agreement to reduce tariffs. Trump hinted at using the Insurrection Act for military dictatorship, sparking heated debate. China's oil supply faces challenges from the Iranian and Venezuelan shocks. Meanwhile, international developments continue, including the US aircraft carrier deployment in the Middle East and France's troop buildup in Greenland. Stay tuned for more detailed reports.

title: Latest global news, military and political news, and breaking news.
summary: Hello everyone, this is Yun Jian, your host from the Daily News Channel. Today is January 24, 2026. Let's quickly review the important global events of the past 24 hours: The President of the European Council publicly questioned the compatibility of Trump's newly launched 'Peace Commission' with the UN Charter; NATO and the EU showed unprecedented unity on the Ukraine issue, while the French Navy took the rare step of seizing a Russian oil tanker in the Mediterranean; new variables emerged in the Middle East, with regime change in Syria disrupting the regional balance of power, and the UAE about to witness high-level trilateral talks between Russia, Ukraine, and the US; the semiconductor industry faced another round of US tariffs, and geopolitical rifts are rapidly spreading to the technology sector. In this episode, we will take you deep into these key turning points.

title: Latest Global Political and Military News
summary: Good viewers, I'm Yun Jian, host of the Daily News Channel. Welcome to today's 'Daily News'. Today is January 22, 2026, and the global political and military situation continues to be highly tense over the past 24 hours. In the Middle East, U.S. President Trump has issued his strongest military threat to Iran to date, while Israel has taken new actions in Gaza and East Jerusalem; across the Atlantic, U.S.-European relations have fallen into a tense confrontation over military deployment in Greenland, with Trump even threatening to use tariff weapons; on the Russia-Ukraine battlefield, Russia continues to launch fierce attacks on Ukrainian energy facilities, plunging Kyiv into a crisis of power and heating during severe cold; in Latin America, the U.S. military operation 'Southern Spear' in Venezuela continues to have repercussions, with rising death tolls and international legal controversies; on the Korean Peninsula, Pyongyang conducted its first missile test in 2026, while Kim Jong-un launched a severe crackdown on senior officials. These events are intertwined, showing the extreme sensitivity and uncertainty of the current international pattern. Now, please follow me to systematically sort out these important news items one by one.

title: Latest Global Political, Military News, and Emergency Events

title: Latest News, Political and Military Related

title: Latest Global Political and Military News
summary: Good viewers, I'm Xiaoxiao, host of the Daily News Channel. Welcome to this episode of Global News Focus. In the Americas, U.S. military operations in Venezuela and strategic attention to Greenland have sparked widespread discussion in the region and Europe. In the Middle East, anti-government protests in Iran and international sanctions continue to ferment, U.S.-Iran tensions continue to escalate, and Russian President Putin has begun to intervene in mediation, while shipping safety in the Red Sea also affects global attention. In Asia, China and Canada have reached an important trade partnership, but friction with the United States and Taiwan on the Taiwan Strait issue remains sharp. In addition, the BRICS+ countries held their first joint naval exercise, indicating that a new security cooperation model is forming. The Davos World Economic Forum, a barometer of the global economy, is about to open, and a landmark global ocean treaty has officially entered into force, injecting new vitality into global environmental governance. The war in Ukraine is still stalemate, and the shortage of air defense ammunition has become a prominent challenge, with the international community accelerating assistance. Next, we will bring you detailed reports on these important news items.

title: Latest News, Political, Economic, and Military Related
summary: Good viewers, I'm Xiaoxiao, host of the Daily News Channel. You are now watching today's news broadcast. Currently, the international situation remains complex and volatile. Economically, market sentiment is fluctuating with the release of key data. China's latest inflation and trade data released today, as well as the strong performance of the RMB, have become important basis for investors to judge the global economic trend. In Europe, the euro zone inflation rate has fallen back to the 2% target level, providing potential space for monetary policy adjustments. In addition, in the Americas, a state-level runoff election in Georgia and the busy legislative agenda of the U.S. House of Representatives have also provided new annotations for the political ecology of the early stage of the new U.S. Congress. At the same time, the semiconductor supply chain has experienced multiple disturbances, military conflicts in South America have shown signs of spillover, and tensions on the Indian subcontinent continue to escalate.
